context: Finally, the polymer beads were separated, washed with acetone and distilled water, then dried at 50°C. The chemically modified polymer beads prepared from D-4VP-10, D-4VP-20, and D-4VP-30 are referred to as D-4VP-10M, D-4VP-20M, and D-4VP-30M, respectively.Post-crosslinking of the polymer beads containing methyl pyridinium groups The post-crosslinking reaction was carried out as described in the literature. First, the starting polymer beads were fully swollen in 1,2-dichloroethane in a 1.0L four-necked separable round-bottomed flask for 3h. Under mild mechanical stirring, anhydrous ferric chloride (40wt% of the starting polymer beads) was added slowly. After stirring for 1h to achieve complete dispersion, the mixture was heated to 80°C for 8h. Finally, the polymer beads were washed with acetone, acetone/0.1M HCl (1:1, v/v), and water, and then dried in an oven at 60°C for at least 48h before use.
